DataElement.preferredName: Access Extension Study Protocol Version Condition Coding System ISO21090.Uid.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: An action plan of a pre-clinical or clinical study describing the procedure for obtaining an experimental drug or device for subjects who are not adequately treated by existing therapy, who do not meet eligibility criteria for enrollment, or who are otherwise unable to participate in a controlled clinical study. NOTE(S): This type of study is used to register all types of non-protocol access to experimental treatments, including protocol exception, single-patient IND, treatment IND, compassionate use, emergency use, continued access and parallel track. The coding system used for recording conditions that are the focus of a study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Access Extension Study Protocol Version Condition Coding System
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The right to obtain or make use of or take advantage of something (as services or membership); the right to enter.  Also, an act or means of approaching.:An addition to the length of something; the spreading of something into new regions.:The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.:A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications._A state of being, such as a state of health.:The activity of implementing rules that are used to map the elements of one set onto the elements of another set, usually on a one-to-one basis.:A group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole.

Concepts.definition: The right to obtain or make use of or take advantage of something (as services or membership); the right to enter.  Also, an act or means of approaching.
To increase in length or duration.

The formal plan of an experiment or research activity, including the objective, rationale, design, materials and methods for the conduct of the study; intervention description, and method of data analysis.
A form or variant of a type or original; one of a sequence of copies of a program, each incorporating new modifications.

The activity of implementing rules that are used to map the elements of one set onto the elements of another set, usually on a one-to-one basis.
A group of independent but interrelated elements comprising a unified whole.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A string that is an identifier, and therefore must be either a string representation of an OID, a UUID, or a simple token taken from a lsit of controlled names for the context in which the Uid is used.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Text; the words of something written.
